name: CHED Scholarship Program
eligibleCourse: Courses identified by the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) https://careersfilipino.com/ched-priority-courses/
qualifications:
The applicant must be a Filipino citizen 
 
The student must be Graduating high school student/ High school graduate with general weighted average (GWA) of at least 90% 
 
Must be a Student-applicant belonging to the special group of persons such as the underprivileged and Homeless Citizens under 
 
Republic Act (RA) No. 7279, Persons with Disability (PWDs) under RA No. 7277 as amended, Solo Parents and/or their 
 
Dependents under RA 8371, shall submit certifications and/or Identification Cards (IDs) issued by the appropriate offices or agencies. 
 
Avail of only one government-funded financial assistance program.

name: DOST-SEI UNDERGRADUATE SCHOLARSHIPS
eligibleCourse: Courses identified by the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) https://careersfilipino.com/ched-priority-courses/
qualifications:
A natural-born Filipino citizen 
 
Applicantâ€™s economic status must not exceed the set values for DOST scholarship Applicant must one of the 5% of the Non-STEM 
 
Strand senior high school graduating class or a member of the STEM Strand senior high school graduating class 
 
A resident of the municipality for 4 years 
 
Your health and moral characters are in good status
 
The applicant must pass the Science and Technology Scholarship Examination

name: GSIS Scholarship Program
eligibleCourse: 4 or 5 year course identified by the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) https://careersfilipino.com/ched-priority-courses/
qualifications: Children or dependents of low-income GSIS members and permanent total disability (PTD) pensioners below 60 years of age.

eligibleCourse:

qualifications:

name: Landbank Gawad Patnubay Scholarship Program
eligibleCourse: BS Agriculture, BS Fisheries or any agriculture-related disciplines
qualifications:
Must be Filipino citizens 
 
With a general weighted average (GWA) of at least 2.5 or its equivalent in each semester, with no grades lower than 3.0 or its equivalent in any subject 
 
The applicant must be children and grandchildren of agrarian reform beneficiaries (ARBs) and small farmers and fishers who are high school graduates.
 
Must not be enjoying any other financial assistance, grant, or scholarship from other external sources

name: Aboitiz Scholarship and Financial Assistance
eligibleCourse:

Data Science
Digital Transformation
Engineering
Information Technology
Sales
e-Commerce
Agriculture
Nutrition
qualifications:
Be a full-time incoming freshman student in a recognized private or public university or college in the Philippines. 
 
Pursuing a degree identified by the Foundation. 
 
Have a general weighted average (GWA) of at least 88% or its equivalent. 
 
Not have a failing grade or incomplete grade. 
 
Not have any record of any form of disciplinary action. 
 
Completed the online application form and submitted the requirements on time.

name: DLSU Midnation Scholarship Program
qualifications:
Be a full-time graduate student currently taking up a Masterâ€™s Program in Clinical Psychology in their last school year/semester. 
 
Be 18 years of age or older. 
 
Have a grade point average of 3.0 or better (on a 4.0 scale). 
 
Applicants must be a member of the student arm of the Psychological Association of the Philippines (PAP)

name: DLSU CRUZ Scholarship
qualifications:
An enrollee of not less than fifteen (15) units for the current trimester in accordance with the course checklist of the program
 
Total gross annual family income not exceeding P 700, 000.00
 
Has no grades lower than 2.000 and a CGPA of at least 3.000 in the previous term prior to application
 
Has no failing grades in any course
 
Good Moral Character and has no major offense
 
Not a concurrent recipient of any major scholarship or financial aid

name: MDFI Scholarship
qualifications:
The applicant must be a Student who is financially-challenged

name: BPI Foundation Pagpupugay Scholarship Program
qualifications:
Qualified next of kin of the following medical front liners who passed away or those who contracted COVID-19 in the line of duty
 
Applicants should be college/university students (1st year-4th year/5th year) of BPIFâ€™s partner schools. 
 
To qualify, eligible students must have and maintain a General Weighted Average (GWA) of 85% or its equivalent, or meet 
 
University standards for the previous academic year (for incoming 1st year) or for the previous semester (for incoming 2nd year-5th year).

name: PHINMA Scholarship
eligibleCourse: Education Degree with specialization in the field of English, Filipino, Mathematics, Science, Social Science, Early Childhood and Information Technology Education
qualifications: Only Freshmen students are qualified to apply.

name: OWWA Scholarship Program
eligibleCourse: 4-year or 5-year baccalaureate course at any college or university are eligible for this scholarship program. Any OFW dependent who is a current OWWA member is eligible to apply.
qualifications:
The Qualifications or Educational Requirements to Apply for OFW Dependentâ€™s Scholarship Program are

The Salary of OFW OWWA members must be $600 or less per month.

For incoming freshmen, the applicant must be a child of an active OWWA member or a sibling of an unmarried OWWA member who is single and under the age of 21.

For Applicants, who are now or have previously been enrolled in college, the applicant must be a child of an active OWWA member who is single and under the age of 30.

He or She must have completed high school and be in good physical and mental health.

He or She must have a good moral conduct.

He or she must pass an admission exam conducted by the state institution or university where he or she intends to enroll in the OWWA Regional Welfare Offices.

He or She must not be a recipient of other scholarships.

name: Bangon Marawi Scholarship
Ayala Foundation U-Go Scholarship
qualifications:
Female

Filipino citizen

Incoming first-year, second-year, or third-year college students for SY 23-24. Incoming fourth-year students for SY 23-24 may apply only if they are taking a five-year course. Students who are expecting to graduate SY 23-24 cannot apply.

Enrolling in a public or state university/college for SY 23-24.

With a desire to excel and a minimum GPA of 85% (or equivalent)

An active member of her community

Without any disciplinary or administrative cases

Aspires to bring positive change to society

A model of integrity in the community

With proof of financial need
